item.title: Deriving the front-door criterion with the do-calculus
item.description: Attention conservation notice: Narrow target audience - will only make sense to people somewhat familiar with causal inference who don’t find the result entirely boring. The Front-Door Criterion Suppose we have a causal graphical model that looks like the following. Assume $ U $ is unmeasured whereas $ X, M, Y $ can be measured. Notice that: All directed paths from $ X $ to $ Y $ flow through $ M $.
